sentence.Network_en: After months of hard work, our plans finally came to fruition .
sentence.Network_cn: 经过几个月的艰苦工作，我们的计划终于完成了。

sentence.Network_en: After much delay, the plan to build the new hospital finally came to fruition.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过许多耽搁以后, 建造新医院的计划终于实现了.

sentence.Network_en: These plans take time to come to fruition.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些方案需要时间才能取得成果。

fruitage 果实fruition 结实；成就frusta frustun 的复数

雅思阅读词汇 ... fruitless adj. 不结果实的 fruition n. 结果实, 成就 recommend vt. 推荐, 介绍.

list.abs: improving style of work , stressing fruition ., 改进作风狠抓落实.
effects of nikethamide on pollen activity and fruition rate of several species of fruit trees ., 尼可刹米对果树花粉生活力及坐果率的影响.
effect of selection for fruition characters of pinus koraiensis ., 红松结实性状的选择效果.
Now growth comes to annual fruition , and preparations are completed for another year , another generation ., 现在各种植物都到了一年一度的收获时光 , 并且准备好迎接下一年 , 下一个时代.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'enjoyment'): via Old French from late Latin fruitio(n-), from frui 'enjoy' (see fruit); the current senses (dating from the late 19th cent.) arose by association with fruit

entry.def: If something comes to fruition, it starts to succeed and produce the results that were intended or hoped for.

example.ex: These plans take time to come to fruition...
example.tran: 这些方案需要时间才能取得成果。

example.ex: His hopes for a new political party have little chance of reaching fruition.
example.tran: 他期盼出现一个新政党的愿望几乎不可能实现。

means.word_mean: 2. enjoyment derived from use or possession
3. something that is made real or concrete;

sentences.sentence: "the victory was the realization of a whole year's work"
